metadata.title: CVE-2024-6232 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a MEDIUM severity vulnerability affecting CPython.Regular expressions that allowed excessive backtracking duringtarfile.TarFile header parsing are vulnerable to ReDoS viaspecifically-crafted tar archives.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-6232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm14').
